page.title: 01RESUME OF BLOCK
page.content: Most of our block is made up of { {Hingston Down} moorland which separates {Callington}from{Gunnislake in East Cornwall. The A390 Liskeard to Tavistock road runs diagonally SW/NE across the block. North of it is{Kit Hill}(333m o.s.l.),a recreational area recently given to the county by{HRH Prince Charles.} South of the road farmland slopes down towards the{River Tamar, {including a}small valley fed by three streams. The block includes part only of {Harrowbarrow and Kelly Bray}villages and the newer eastern part of Callington with 2 schools, an industrial estate and 4 new housing estates,but not the town centre. Old tin mines, their associated buildings and shafts, and disused quarries are a feature of the block.
